huddle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if a group of people huddle together, they stay very close to each other, especially because they are cold or frightened
huddle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: We lay huddled together for warmth.
People huddled around the radio, waiting for news.
huddle.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to lie or sit with your arms and legs close to your body because you are cold or frightened
huddle.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The snow blew against his huddled body.
huddle.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to sit or stand with a small group of people in order to discuss something privately
huddle.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The executive board huddled to discuss the issue.
huddle.translation[0].definitions[3].def: if American football players huddle, they gather around one player who tells them the plan for the next part of the game
huddle.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a group of people or things that are close together, but not arranged in any particular order, pattern, or system
huddle.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Huddles of men stood around talking.
huddle.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a group of players in American football who gather around one player who tells them the plan for the next part of the game
